page.title: 14GLOSSOPDALE UNEMPLOYMENT
page.content: In 1985 the number of unemployed is rising rapidly and more facilities are needed for them.{ Hadfield Centre arranges{discos}and{fun nights}and the unemployed are let in at almost half price. We rang Glossop Leisure Centre to ask how much they reduced the prices for the unemployed. We found that in most cases the fee was reduced by half, eg. the normal fee for badminton, volleyball, basketball and tabletennis is{50p.}whereas a{UB40} card holder pays{25p.}There are{2,244 unemployed in the Glossop area and as the{average age}for an unemployed person is between{20-29}this is a useful project{reducing}the{cost}of the sports they play. The number of mill jobs has drastically decreased; the main jobs that people do are in the clothing,food,foam,and chemical industries.
